content:
Yes, the contributions of these friars, both male and female, to the spread of Christianity cannot be overstated. They played a crucial role in shaping the course of history and helped to establish Christianity as a major world religion.

It's difficult to say how different the world would be today if they had not dedicated their lives to this cause. Without their work, it's possible that Christianity may not have spread as widely or as rapidly as it did, and the shape of the world today could be very different. What is certain, however, is that the legacy of these friars and their contributions to the Church and the world continue to be felt today.
